alert.note: Alert for Halifax; Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 5:43PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Warren and northwestern Halifax Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 543 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Norlina, or near Warrenton, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Roanoke Rapids, Warrenton, Norlina, Littleton, Macon, Medoc Mountain State Park, Lake Gaston, Wise, Southpointe And Morningstar Marinas and Arcola. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central North Carolina.
